author: salen
title: DApps and Integrations
description: 2022年にエンドユーザーにとって最も価値のあるアプリケーションは何か？

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The objective of the challenge directly supports two of three Fund8 strategic goals: grow the number of contributors and grow the app and dev ecosystem.

Building apps and intergrations is one of the best ways to grow the adoption of Cardano as evidenced by the practical examples of competing blockchains.

The challenge allows for all types of apps and integrations, thus having the maximum possible impact.

For the above reasons, I have assigned a score of 5 points.

One thought that could further improve the impact of the proposal: what trully helps to grow the adoption is a clear differentiation/competitve advantages in the eyes of potential users. So, I'd suggest adding questions looking into the competitive advantages created by apps and integrations, such as:
1) Which use cases with significant audience we can solve better than other ecosystems?
2) Which new/unusual use cases with significant audience can we bring to blockchain for the first time?
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the proposed challenge budget of $2.5M and previous similar challenges run by Catalyst community, the community can definitely address the challenge and attract new developers into the ecosystem.

I have made a deduction of 1 point because the challenge team (the proposer) consists of only one person, and it is not clear how much experience the team has with building Cardano apps and integrations to provide experience-based advice to participants. So, I set a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposed KPIs allow to capture progress, by capturing the growth in the technical usage (transactions, tokens use, etc.) and community growth (the number of teams, etc.), which do allow to track adoption.

However, given the underlying objective of the challenge - to grow the adoption of Cardano, I'd advice considering the following metrics:
1) The % of users brought by apps built for this challenge.
2) The satisfaction of users with the apps in comparison with existing alernatives.
3) the marketshare of the apps built in this challenge vs their alternatives for other blockhains, etc.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because the suggested metrics did not fully capture that impact on user adoption.
- 1 points because the suggested metrics did not consider the user satisfaction and competitivenes of the solutions vs potential alternatives.

The assigned score is 3.
f6_assessments.reply:
This assessment is very thorough and may warrant an excellent score but I was on the verge of flagging it just to bring attention to some general confusion that will be reoccuring if the community does not clarify certain aspects of challenge setting proposals. Hence it is important to highlight for the community advisory body. 

On the second metric, feasibility, the CA deducts one star because it is assumed that those who propose are also the ones who are part of the challenge team. This is not correct as I specifically asked about this in the telegram proposers' chat. Challenge teams can be mustered/gathered afterwards too.

On Verifiability, this CA has some ideas that would improve the measurement of progress towards Cardano adoption by end-users. Though feedback is good, I do not believe they warrant a 2-star deduction seeing that the existing metrics are recognised by the CA to satisfy the requirement of being able to track progress towards the challenge goal, which is what CAs are asked to evaluate. If CAs were asked "is this the best way of doing/auditing X" then that would lead to a very different Project Catalyst rating system. 
 
Furthermore, there seems to be some confusion in regards to what KPIs in challenge setting proposals are intended for. On one hand, these KPIs could refer to assessing the success of the challenge itself. On the other, these KPIs could also be intended to outline what KPIs proposals that are submitted to this challenge could be evaluated against. CA suggestions 1 is of the former type. Suggestions 2 and 3 could be applied to both. There is definitely room for improvement in terms of clarifying what KPIs are designed for here.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge has existed since Fund 4 and closely aligns with Cardano's mission. It meets 2 of the 3 strategic goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget request is 10 times the Fund 7 budget despite the total budget only doubling. This is a massive funding increase. The challenge has 86 assessed proposals in Fund 7, which is the largest challenge but there were 4 other challenges that were comparable in size. This challenge accounted for 9% of the assessed proposals in Fund 7 but is asking for 20% of the total budget in Fund 8. A budget for half of this amount would be very feasible however I have my doubts that the Catalyst community has the capacity to address the budget of this challenge based upon the disproportionate funding cuts it would place on the other challenges.
f6_assessments.q2: Th success criteria and metrics are comprehensive and progress to addressing the challenge can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: Building Dapps and integrations is a key-components for the adoption of Cardano. Providing a challenge for this will ensure the quality of Dapps that are built on Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Since the challenge has existed in the previous funds, I believe it is highly feasible that this challenge will engage the community. However, a fund of 2.5 million seems way too much compared to the $250.000 we have now.
f6_assessments.q2: Looking at the success metrics on this proposal they are in line with the proposal itself. Great idea to implement tokens into the success metrics.

importance: 質の高いDappsと統合は、Cardanoの実用性と採用率を高めます。このような幅広い資金調達のチャレンジは、より多くの提案を促します。
success: カルダノの上に斬新で実行可能なアプリケーションが構築され、ユーザーを魅了する。統合することで、より多くの採用が可能になる。
